item.title: Kristen add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds the most discoveries, is not "Eureka!" (I found it!) but 'That's funny..." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Martin Luther King, Jr
item.description: "Science investigates; religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge, which is power; religion gives man wisdom, which is control. Science deals mainly with facts; religion deals mainly with values. The two are not rivals." -- Martin Luther King, Jr

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Larry Niven
item.description: "The dinosaurs became extinct because they didn't have a space program. And if we become extinct because we don't have a space program, it'll serve us right!" -- Larry Niven

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Arguing with anonymous strangers on the Internet is a sucker's game because they almost always turn out to be&mdash;or to be indistinguishable from&mdash;self-righteous sixteen-year-olds possessing infinite amounts of free time." -- Neal Stephenson
